programme.title: Space Channel Interviews-Lockheed Martin's Rick Ambrose
programme.desc: An exclusive interview with Rick Ambrose, Vice President of Lockheed Martin. Rick is a thought leader and visionary and shares his views on the new space age, the new Lunar Rover and how he rose to one of the top positions at Lockheed Martin. Duration: 3600

programme.title: 2021: Space Channel's Year in Space
programme.desc: 2021 brought historic advances for mankind in space. From private space industry launching civilians into space, troubles on the ISS and China becoming a true space competitor, it has been amazing year to witness. And for the first time...there was Space Channel. Enjoy a look back at our coverage of launches, news and documentaries as well as movies, music and series. Duration: 14400

programme.title: Space Channel News Update: Getting to space heats up.
programme.desc: Virgin Orbit is successfully providing lunacy services using the unique technique. Xplore is providing critical space based data and Brownsville host the important Select USA event. Duration: 1800

programme.title: Space Tourist
programme.desc: Space Tourist goes to Australia, UAE and Los Angeles to find great Derek and luxury stargazing vacations as well as all the space related activities in Los Angeles. Including experiencing Zero-G! Duration: 1800

programme.title: Latest News - Tide in Space
programme.desc: SpaceX sent Tide detergent to astronauts on the ISS so they can figure out how to do laundry for long-haul trips to Mars. Astronauts on the ISS received a shipment of items onboard a SpaceX spacecraft on Wednesday. The shipment included specially-developed laundry detergent made by Tide. Duration: 224

programme.title: Health Report - NASA Food Upgrade
programme.desc: In coordination with the Canadian Space Agency, NASA is asking the public to help create sustainable food production technology that can be done with few resources and minimal waste. Duration: 194

programme.title: Space Channel Movies : Dark Star
programme.desc: In the mid-22nd century, mankind has begun to colonize interstellar space. Armed with artificially intelligent Thermostellar Triggering Devices, which can talk and reason, the scout ship Dark Star searches for "unstable planets" which might threaten future colonization. Twenty years into its mission, the Dark Star has aged and suffers frequent malfunctions. Commanding officer Powell has died in one such event, but remains aboard in cryogenic suspension. Lieutenant Doolittle, a former surfer from Malibu, has taken over as commander. The tedium of their work has driven the crew of Pinback, Boiler, and Talby "around the bend", so they have created distractions for themselves. Duration: 7200

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: There is no one coming, no one to help. She's alone. Duration: 1246

programme.title: Latest News - China Starlink update
programme.desc: As commercial and government space programs continue to overlap, China seems particularly worried about SpaceX. According to China Military Online, an official website linked to China’s Central Military Commission, Elon Musk’s SpaceX might be used by the “hegemony-obsessed US” to dominate space and bring “chaos or calamity” to the world. Duration: 190

programme.title: Edge of Infinity - ISLANDS
programme.desc:
In a sense, each of us is an island. In another sense, however, we are all one. For though islands appear separate, and may even be situated at great distances from one another, they are only extrusions of the same planet, Earth.
- J. Donald Walters Duration: 234

programme.title: David Becker - Truth Lies Within
programme.desc: Jazz Guitarist David Becker captures the ultimate Universal duality that's hard to ignore. In Partnership with Space Channel Music, David's melodious guitar takes us on a journey through space and time to discover the truth in all things, and our connection and rhythm with the Cosmos Duration: 500

programme.title: New Mars
programme.desc: A new generation lives underground on Mars preparing to begin a new life as the colonists of a planet which is being terraformed into a new habitable world. Duration: 1333

programme.title: Latest News - Red Moon Rising
programme.desc: In 2021, it achieved an average of more than one launch per week for the first time in its orbital spaceflight history, making it the busiest year for its space program to date. We watched the country pass many milestones from successfully landing its first rover on Mars and test flying a hypersonic spaceplane to building the core module for its Tiangong space station and launching the first taikonauts onto the said module. Duration: 300

programme.title: Space Channel Store

programme.title: MANTA
programme.desc: Work on Mars will leave you breathless. Duration: 300

programme.title: Alien Mugshots
programme.desc: Binky Boghart is a galactic cleptomaniac who is always armed and extremely dangerous. Be on the lookout for this Saturn sized scumbag as you start your day. Duration: 180

programme.title: Edge of Infinity - Our Fragile Oasis
programme.desc: Seeing something with your eyes, but you experience it emotionally and viscerally as it if was ecstasy and a feeling of oneness. Astronauts describe it as a cosmic interconnected euphoria, with an overwhelming sense of bliss and timelessness. Duration: 556

programme.title: David Becker - Around the Universe
programme.desc: For more than three decades, Grammy and Emmy nominated guitarist, composer, producer David Becker has continued to define himself as one of the best and most unique voices in jazz and contemporary music by combining diverse influences and a passion for the new and different, and his ability to play for the present while always keeping an eye on the past and future. He has led the critically acclaimed DAVID BECKER TRIBUNE to a worldwide audience by performing in more than 35 countries. Duration: 262

programme.title: Commander Z - Floating for Seven
programme.desc: From the Commander's perspective, the world seems upside down...or is it the Commander who is indeed on the upside of the downbeat? Duration: 330
